intro: Solenolantana carlesii, commonly known as the Carles's lantana, is a flowering plant native to the island of La Palma in the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Solenolantana carlesii is well adapted to the volcanic soils and coastal conditions of its native habitat.
